description: Indicates the total number of users who have currently logged into the target server.
interpretation: The detailed diagnosis of this measure if enabled, lists the name of the users who have logged into the target server and their IP addresses.
troubleshootingSteps: Use system commands or tools (for example, `who`, `w`, `users` on Linux, or session/user monitoring tools on Windows) to list all currently logged‑in users and their sessions.[web:46][web:51]
Verify that each logged‑in account is expected for this server and time window; investigate any unknown or unusual usernames or IP addresses for possible misuse or compromise.[web:45][web:46][web:51]
If there are too many concurrent users causing resource contention, enforce connection limits, session timeouts, or redistribute users across servers.[web:42][web:50][web:53]
Regularly log and audit user login activity so spikes in the current user count can be correlated with planned maintenance, deployments, or potential security incidents.[web:45][web:46][web:49]

description: Indicates the number of users who are not authorized to login into the target server.
interpretation: The detailed diagnosis of this measure lists the name of the unauthorized users who have logged into the target server and their IP addresses.
troubleshootingSteps: Immediately review the list of unauthorized users and their source IP addresses, and terminate any active unauthorized sessions.[web:45][web:46][web:48][web:52]

Investigate how these accounts gained access by reviewing authentication logs, security event logs, and recent configuration changes, looking for weak credentials, stolen accounts, or misconfigured access controls.[web:45][web:46][web:48][web:49]
Disable or remove unauthorized accounts, tighten group memberships and logon rights, and enforce stronger authentication (for example, MFA and stricter password policies).?[web:48][web:51][web:54]
Configure continuous monitoring and alerting for unexpected logins, logins from unusual locations, or logins by accounts that should never access this server.[web:45][web:46][web:48][web:49][web:52]
